feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 19 at 3:19PM AKDT until October 21 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM FRIDAY TO 6 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility one half mile or less at times. entry.cap:areaDesc: Dalton Highway Summits; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 19 at 10:11AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Through Tonight... Snowfall and gusty winds between 20 and 30 mph will this morning and persist into tonight, resulting in localized areas of blowing snow, especially over higher terrain. Snowfall accumulations of 2 to 3 inches can be expected. Conditions are expected to improve Friday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Upper Chena River Valley; Yukon Flats

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 19 at 10:11AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Blowing Snow Through This Evening... As of 10am Thursday, Fairbanks had 2.0 inches of snow and hillside locations north and west of town reported 2 to 3 inches of snow. Snow has now tapered off to light snow showers from Fairbanks west, and less than one quarter inch of additonal snow is expected for the remainder of today.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 11:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Through Friday... Elevated and rough surf up to 1.5 feet above the normal high tide is expected along the Chukchi Sea coast, including Kotzebue Sound and north-facing coasts of the Seward Peninsula. North to northwesterly winds 25 to 40 mph will cause elevated surf for coastal areas of the Chukchi Sea. Winds will gradually decrease
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 11:26PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tonight Through Friday... Elevated and rough surf up to 1 foot above the normal high tide is expected along the western Arctic Coast from Point Hope to Wainwright. North to northwesterly winds from 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph near Cape Lisburne will develop near Wainwright Thursday night. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 11:26PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Friday and Saturday... Elevated and rough surf up to 1 foot above the normal high tide is expected along the Arctic Coast from Utqiagvik to Kaktovik. West to northwesterly winds will increase Friday to 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph, with stronger winds gusting to 55 mph at Kaktovik. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 19 at 2:31PM PDT until October 20 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet with local sets to 20 feet are expected on west and northwest facing beaches into tonight. Surf will subside slowly late tonight and Friday morning. There is a high risk of dangerous rip currents through Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
